description: President Biden and congressional leaders met Tuesday to work on a solution toward averting a government shutdown. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has the latest on where negotiations stand.
title: Schumer, McConnell suggest progress being made to avoid shutdown

description: President Biden is facing a test of his support in the Michigan primary Tuesday. Some Democrats there are urging voters to choose "uncommitted" to send a message about his response to the Israel-Hamas war. Politico reporter Brakkton Booker and Wall Street Journal reporter Dante Chinni join "America Decides" to analyze the hurdles facing the Biden campaign in Michigan.
title: What the Michigan protest vote push could mean for Biden in November

description: Michigan voters are heading to the polls in Democratic and Republican primary elections Tuesday with the potential of major implications for November. CBS News' Caitlin Huey-Burns and Ed O'Keefe have more.
title: Biden faces test in Michigan primary with "uncommitted" vote effort

description: When asked for basics on elections, artificial intelligence tools provided wrong information more than half the time, one analysis found.
title: AI chatbots spit out wildly inaccurate election info, study finds

description: Michigan is the latest state to go to the polls in the 2024 presidential primary season, with both Democrats and Republicans going to the polls to vote on Tuesday.
title: 2024 Michigan primary live updates as voting kicks off

description: Terrence Bradley, a former law partner and divorce lawyer for special prosecutor Nathan Wade, testified Tuesday at a hearing over the relationship between Wade and Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis. The case could disqualify Willis and Wade from prosecuting Georgia's election interference case against Donald Trump. A Trump co-defendant alleges Willis financially benefited from her relationship with Wade, whom she hired as a special prosecutor in the Trump case.
title: Nathan Wade's former law partner questioned about Fani Willis relationship

description: Unseasonably warm temperatures are hitting at least 300 locations in the U.S. this week. CBS News national correspondent Dave Malkoff reports from Atlanta.
title: Wave of warm temperatures hits the U.S.

description: Republicans say the materials related to the special counsel's investigation into President Biden's handling of classified documents is relevant to their impeachment inquiry.
title: House GOP subpoenas DOJ for materials on special counsel's Biden probe

description: It's important to know which insurance types you may be able to delay — and which ones you shouldn't wait to buy.
title: 3 insurance types you shouldn't wait to buy

description: The legality of a ban on bump stocks that was issued under the Trump administration will be under consideration by the Supreme Court on Wednesday.
title: What to know about the Supreme Court case over Trump-era bump stock ban

description: Warby Parker, GlassesUSA, Zenni Optical, Roka and LensCrafters: The 5 absolute best places to buy glasses online and save
title: Best places to buy prescription glasses online (and save money)

description: Are high credit card payments weighing on your budget? Find out how to reduce your minimum payments here.
title: How to qualify for lower credit card payments

description: A doctor. A teacher. An engineer. This is what children in Gaza told us they want to be when they grow up.
title: Children in Gaza talk about their dreams for the future

description: Vehicle maker's fourth recall in six days seeks to address issue that can lead to parts separating from the axles.
title: Toyota recalls 381,000 Tacoma pickups to fix potential crash risk

description: Terrence Bradley, the former law partner and divorce lawyer for Nathan Wade, testified he was speculating when he told a defense attorney for one of Donald Trump's co-defendants about an alleged relationship between Wade and Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis. The defense attorneys in the Trump case allege that Willis engaged in an improper relationship with Wade, whom she hired to work on the racketeering case against Trump, and financially benefited from it.
title: Wade's ex-lawyer says he was speculating when he told attorney about Fani Willis relationship

description: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg's office is pointing to former President Donald Trump's past behavior during court procedures as it seeks a gag order in his "hush money" payment trial. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson breaks down the latest in Trump's legal woes.
title: Manhattan DA seeks Trump gag order in Stormy Daniels "hush money" case

description: Macy's says it will be closing 150 stores, or about 30% of its locations, to focus on expanding its luxury brands, Bloomingdale's and Bluemercury. CBS MoneyWatch associate managing editor Aimee Picchi breaks down the store closures and the potential impact.
title: Macy's to close 150 stores over 3 years

description: If you're trying to fix a less-than-stellar credit score quickly, there are some strategies you can use to do that.
title: 5 effective ways to fix your credit fast

description: NBA League Pass is your ticket to watching out-of-market NBA games and local NBA games on the go.
title: What is NBA League Pass? What you need to know about the basketball streaming service

description: Save on luggage and travel accessories from QVC.
title: QVC has incredible luggage and travel deals ahead of spring break: Our top picks

description: Jam Master Jay, whose real name was Jason Mizell, was gunned down in 2002​ inside his music studio in Hollis, Queens.
title: Verdict reached in Jam Master Jay murder trial

description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said the meeting at the White House between President Biden and other congressional leaders was one of the most intense he has ever attended. Schumer told reporters that conversations over the looming government shutdown were productive, but also said House Speaker Mike Johnson pushed back on aid for Ukraine until more is done to secure the U.S.-Mexico border. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane discusses the takeaways from Schumer and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries' remarks.
title: "Intense" White House meeting over shutdown, Ukraine aid, Schumer says

description: House Speaker Mike Johnson spoke to reporters Tuesday after he met with President Biden and other congressional leaders at the White House on Tuesday where discussions on a supplemental foreign aid package remained tense. Johnson is calling for changes at the U.S.-Mexico border before more money is dispensed to Ukraine and other U.S. allies. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane and Weijia Jiang are following the latest.
title: Johnson says "very optimistic" on avoiding government shutdown, presses for border fixes

description: Michigan is holding its 2024 presidential primary elections Tuesday, where former President Donald Trump and former U.N. Ambassador Nikki Haley will appear on the Republican ballot, and President Biden will appear on the Democratic ballot along with Rep. Dean Phillips of Minnesota. CBS News campaign reporter Aaron Navarro reports.
title: Michigan voters head to polls for Democratic, Republican primaries

description: President Biden met with the top congressional leaders on Tuesday as a partial government shutdown looms. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, House Speaker Mike Johnson and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries also discussed funding for Ukraine and other key U.S. allies. CBS News' Nikole Killion reports.
title: Will Biden's meeting with congressional leaders help avert a partial government shutdown?

description: Although President Biden said Monday that a cease-fire deal in the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza is close, key players in the Middle East are not saying much about where negotiations stand. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab is following the developments from Tel Aviv.
title: Biden gives potential Israel-Hamas cease-fire timeline

description: Ralph Hendry and Kathy Brandel were likely thrown into the ocean and died, police said.
title: What to know about the U.S. couple feared dead in the Caribbean

description: Select CDs are currently offering savers an impressive 6.5% return on their money. Here's what that looks like.
title: How much can you earn with a 6.5% CD interest rate?

description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said he and the other leaders at the White House meeting made clear to Speaker Mike Johnson how "vital" the aid to Ukraine is.
title: Schumer describes "intense" White House meeting on Ukraine aid

description: Antidepressant use among people between the ages of 12 and 25 has increased nearly 64% since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a new study published in the journal Pediatrics. Those numbers are even higher among teen girls. Dr. Sue Varma, psychiatrist and author of the new book "Practical Optimism," joined CBS News to discuss.
title: Youth use of antidepressants spiked since pandemic, study shows

description: An adjustable-rate mortgage could help you save on interest when you buy a home, but how does it work?
title: What is an adjustable-rate mortgage (ARM)?

description: New data from the Federal Housing Finance Agency shows prices for homes rose 6.5% over the last year. CBS News contributor Javier E. David has more on whether there will be any relief coming for prospective home buyers. He also discussed Macy's plans to close about 150 underperforming stores over the next three years.
title: Home prices rose 6.5% over the last year, report finds

description: The Federal Trade Commission is suing to stop the proposed $25 billion deal between Kroger and Albertsons for what would be the biggest grocery store merger in U.S. history. CBS News senior business and technology correspondent Jo Ling Kent has more.
title: FTC sues to block Kroger-Albertsons merger

description: "I go around the world to tell about my mom. So maybe someone in the U.S. can hear me and help find her," said 13-year-old Sasha Radchuck.
title: Ukrainian children recount horrors of being kidnapped by Russian soldiers

description: If you walk around the Rahway Trail in the South Mountain Reservation of Millburn, New Jersey, you might see small fairy homes tucked into the trees. The idea to add small dwellings to the landscape came from a woman named Therese Ojibway, who 10 years ago wanted her son, who has autism, to have a safe space to explore in the wilderness. She created the Fairy Trail, which people of all ages can enjoy.
title: Mom creates whimsical fairy forest inspired by son with autism

description: The FDA's new regulations are due to be published this year.
title: FDA to develop new "healthy" logo – here's what it could look like

description: There are a few compelling reasons why beginner investors, in particular, should consider opening a gold IRA today.
title: 5 reasons beginner investors should open a gold IRA now

description: Police in Grenada believe Ralph Hendry and Kathy Brandel, an American couple from Virginia, were thrown overboard and died after their boat was allegedly hijacked last week by three escaped prisoners. CBS News correspondent Cristian Benavides has more.
title: Missing Virginia couple in Grenada feared dead after alleged yacht hijacking

description: Experts warn that Mexico's emboldened drug cartels could make this summer's elections the most violent ever.
title: 2 mayoral candidates killed within hours of each other in Mexico

description: President Biden says a cease-fire agreement for Gaza could come in a matter of days but there are worries Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu may try to torpedo any deal. Meanwhile, Palestinians in Gaza are struggling to find food. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab has more.
title: Starvation in Gaza amid cease-fire talks

description: "The Many Lives of Mama Love" is a memoir by Lara Love Hardin that has been selected as  Oprah Winfrey's latest book club pick.
title: Oprah chooses "The Many Lives of Mama Love" as newest book club pick

description: President Biden is meeting with congressional leaders on Tuesday with a spending bill needed to avert a partial government shutdown by Friday. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: 3 days before partial government shutdown, Biden meeting with lawmakers

description: Amazon is offering a $15 credit when you buy Bounty, Cottonelle, Glad, Hefty, Scott and more top grocery brands.
title: Get a $15 credit when you spend $60 on Brawny paper towels, Clorox wipes and more household essentials at Amazon

description: Buying a burger when there's a long line may soon cost more than at slower times, as demand pricing hits fast food.
title: Wendy's explores bringing surge pricing to its fast-food restaurants

description: The legislation, first introduced in 2022, would preempt state efforts to restrict the fertility treatment.
title: Sen. Tammy Duckworth to bring up vote on bill to protect nationwide IVF access

description: Small whimsical cottages are hidden in the tree trunks and branches – a surprisingly sweet sight in an otherwise normal-looking forest.
title: Woman creates fairy trail inspired by son with autism

description: Americans are spending more money on food than they have in 30 years,​ and Kellogg's CEO Gary Pilnick has a solution to that: eat cereal for dinner.
title: Kellogg's CEO suggests cereal for dinner amid inflation

description: Rural Tennessee resident, Debra Prichard, was flown to her local hospital via helicopter ambulance after suffering a devastating stroke from which she died.
title: Deceased patient's family owes $81,000 for a single air-ambulance flight

description: Documents obtained by "60 Minutes" show the Secret Service shelled out more than $12 million to protect John Bolton and Robert O'Brien, two former national security advisers, over the course of a year.
title: Documents show $12 million price tag to protect two Trump advisers from Iran

description: These deals won't last long.
title: CBS Morning Deals: Save 35% on heated massagers

description: Ridouan Taghi is the alleged mastermind of the Amsterdam-based group called the "Mocro-maffia" — which the judge called a "murder organization."
title: Drug kingpin accused of leading "well-oiled killing machine" learns fate

description: Are you a senior who's thinking about purchasing a home? Here are five tips to help you navigate the market.
title: 5 homebuying tips for seniors

description: The Sixers and Celtics face off tonight for the last time of the 2024 NBA regular season. Here's how to watch the game.
title: How to watch today's Philadelphia 76ers vs. Boston Celtics NBA game: Livestream options, starting time, more

description: Hazmat teams responded to the home of Donald Trump Jr. Monday after he said he received a letter containing white powder and a death threat. CBS News correspondent Christian Benavides has more from outside the gated community in Jupiter, Florida, where the former president's son lives.
title: Donald Trump Jr. says envelope with white powder, death threat was mailed to his home

description: After some controversy, Google is planning to re-launch its Gemini artificial intelligence picture generator in the next few weeks. The company paused the tool earlier this month after users discovered historical inaccuracies and concerning responses in the tool. Maria Curi, tech policy reporter for Axios, joined CBS News to discuss Gemini.
title: Google relaunching Gemini AI picture generator

description: Lights, camera, Ohtani! How to watch Shohei Ohtani's first game-time at-bat in a Los Angeles Dodgers uniform.
title: How to watch Shohei Ohtani's Los Angeles Dodgers MLB Spring Training debut today: Livestream options, starting time

description: Cheryl Hines joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss all things "Curb Your Enthusiasm" and her self-care line she launched last year with her daughter called "Hines & Young."
title: Cheryl Hines on final season of "Curb Your Enthusiasm"

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, Gayle Bass shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: In its battle against the fentanyl epidemic, the DEA is intensifying crackdowns on pill press usage, crucial in the illicit production of fentanyl-laced pills. The agency is now putting e-commerce platforms on notice to regulate sales under existing laws to avoid facing legal action.
title: DEA targets pill presses in escalated fight against Fentanyl crisis

description: In the midst of war's chaos, Ukraine's children face unimaginable horrors, with tens of thousands torn from their families by the conflict. Now, they are reaching out to the U.S. and global allies for support in their fight against the Russian invasion.
title: Ukraine's youngest victims talk about being taken by Russian soldiers

description: CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger offers advice for couples striving for financial harmony. Discover the key conversations for alignment on money matters, the pros and cons of joint versus separate accounts, and how to turn those discussions into a solid financial plan.
title: Expert gives tip on navigating love and finances

description: """CBS Mornings"" exclusively reveals Oprah Winfrey's latest book club selection: ""The Many Lives of Mama Love,"" the powerful memoir by Lara Love Hardin. The author talks to  David Begnaud in her Northern California home about her journey through addiction, legal battles and redemption."
title: Oprah selects  "The Many Lives of Mama Love" as newest book club selection

description: Only three of Consumer Reports' top picks this year also featured on its 2023 list, while more electric and hybrid cars made the cut.
title: See the 10 cars that made Consumer Reports' top picks for 2024

description: Ruth Gottesman's monumental $1 billion contribution to the Albert Einstein College of Medicine marks a groundbreaking moment, ensuring free tuition for both present and future students. David Begnaud delves into the significance of this generous gift and talks to a student directly impacted by this life-changing donation.
title: Historic $1 billion donation secures free tuition at Albert Einstein College of Medicine

description: Despite being declared eliminated in 2000, measles cases are on the rise across the U.S., with 36 instances identified in 16 states since January. Florida emerged as a hotspot with nine cases, as the state's surgeon general challenges CDC vaccine guidelines. CBS News’ chief medical correspondent Dr. Jon LaPook provides an in-depth analysis of this alarming development.
title: An in-depth look at what's causing the measles to makes a comeback in the U.S.

description: The uncorrected copy proof of the debut novel in the Harry Potter series was bought for pennies more than a quarter-century ago with J.K. Rowling's name misspelled on the title page.
title: 1st print version of debut "Harry Potter" novel sold at auction

description: In a bold move to protect competition, the Federal Trade Commission has launched a lawsuit to prevent the $24.6 billion merger between grocery behemoths Kroger and Albertson's, citing risks of higher prices for consumers and lower wages for employees. The supermarkets argue the merger is vital for standing up to retail titans like Walmart and Amazon.
title: FTC fights Kroger-Albertson's mega merger

description: With fixed and lower interest rates, home equity loans can be more advantageous than other popular lending options.
title: Why a home equity loan is better than these 5 alternatives

description: Australian police say they found the bodies of Jesse Baird and Luke Davies after a police officer lover who allegedly killed them told investigators where to look.
title: Bodies of ex-TV reporter, partner found after alleged killer gives location

description: Congress is racing to avert a partial government shutdown ahead of a Saturday deadline.
title: Biden, congressional leaders to meet as government shutdown nears

description: Switching up your hair part isn't just about style — it can also help support the health of your hair. A dermatologist shares how.
title: Side parts are back. Here's why switching your look is good for hair health.

description: The battle for the role of commander in chief intensifies as former President Donald Trump is set to overshadow Nikki Haley in Michigan's primary, despite her unwavering commitment to persevere.
title: What's at stake during Michigan's primary

description: U.S. President Joe Biden hints at a potential ceasefire in Gaza, revealing Israel's conditional agreement to halt its offensive during Ramadan in exchange for hostage releases by Hamas.
title: Israel is ready to pause its war in Gaza during Ramadan, Biden says

description: New footage reveals the chaos of a shooting event at Houston's Lakewood Church, captured on police bodycam two weeks ago. The videos show the moment off-duty officers engaged a shooter, who alarmingly brought her 7-year-old son to the scene. The child, tragically caught in the crossfire, is now in critical condition.
title: Police body camera footage released of shooting at Lakewood Church

description: Nikki Haley is sharpening her criticism of Donald Trump as the Michigan primary begins. Also, President Biden says he's optimistic about reaching a Mideast ceasefire. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Nikki Haley and Donald Trump face off in Michigan primary

description: With the clock ticking down, President Biden is set to meet with leaders from both sides in a crucial attempt to strike a deal and avoid another partial government shutdown.
title: Biden seeks bipartisan solution to avert government shutdown

description: Mauritius authorities blocked the ship from docking for a day because 15 people on board had vomiting and diarrhea.
title: Stranded cruise ship allowed to dock in Mauritius after cholera scare

description: Top U.N. expert on food rights accuses Israel of deliberately and illegally starving Gazan civilians as Biden pushes for a cease-fire.
title: U.N. official accuses Israel of deliberately starving civilians in Gaza

description: Under pressure from investors, Macy's is closing 150 underperforming stores as it leans into its Bloomingdale's and Bluemercury brands.
title: Macy's to close 150 stores, or about 30% of its locations

description: A family of four, inlcuding a 3-year-old and an 11-year-old, froze to death trying to enter the U.S. from Canada, authorities said.
title: Arrest made 2 years after family froze to death near U.S.-Canada border

description: Democrats, Republicans, independents and felons may vote in Michigan's 2024 primary.
title: Who can vote in the 2024 Michigan primary?

description: Prince William will not make a scheduled appearance at a memorial service at Windsor Castle due to a personal matter, Kensington Palace says.
title: Prince William pulls out of scheduled appearance over personal matter

description: Don Henley was asked about the incident before he testified he never gave away handwritten pages of lyrics to "Hotel California" and other Eagles hits.
title: Don Henley asked at lyrics trial about time teen overdosed at his home

description: A male music producer is the latest person to accuse Sean "Diddy" Combs of sexual misconduct. A Combs lawyer calls the allegation "pure fiction."
title: Male music producer accuses Sean "Diddy" Combs of sexual misconduct

description: Michigan's presidential primary is earlier in 2024 than in the past few cycles. Find out who and what are on the ballot, and see a sample ballot here.
title: What's on the Michigan ballot for the 2024 primary?

description: Jose Ibarra, who's charged with murdering Georgia nursing student Laken Riley, disfigured her skull, court documents say.
title: Georgia nursing student murder suspect disfigured her skull, documents say

description: A photographer says Taylor Swift's father punched him in the face after the end of the Australian leg of the pop superstar's Eras Tour.
title: Taylor Swift's father allegedly punched photographer in face in Australia

description: The suit says the 42-year-old doctor ate at Raglan Road in Disney Springs in October and was assured the food would be prepared without dairy and nuts.
title: Disney sued after, family says, NYU doctor died from allergic reaction to meal

description: Bodycam video from Lakewood Church shooting released; Massive donation provides free tuition at Bronx medical school
title: 2/26: CBS Evening News

description: Donald Trump Jr. received a letter at his Florida home on Monday afternoon containing a white powdery substance, officials said.
title: Units respond after Donald Trump Jr. gets envelope with powdery substance

description: John Dickerson reports on the Michigan GOP and Democratic primaries, President Biden says he is "hopeful" of a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas by Monday, and Sweden clears the final hurdle to join NATO.
title: 2/26: Prime Time with John Dickerson

description: In Florida, where abortion is banned at 15 weeks, Black women are nearly four times as likely than White women to die from complications related to pregnancy, the DLCC noted.
title: Abortion restrictions disproportionately impact Black women, Democratic memo says

description: Heritage Auctions called the box of hockey cards a "Holy Grail" case. It sold for $3.72 million at auction.
title: Box filled with hockey cards sells for more than $3.7 million at auction

description: The Supreme Court heard arguments Monday in cases that will likely shape the future of free speech online. Jimmy Hoover, Supreme Court reporter for the National Law Journal, joins CBS News to unpack what's at stake.
title: How the Supreme Court could reshape social media

description: After Nikki Haley lost the South Carolina Republican primary to former President Donald Trump on Saturday, her biggest donors, the Koch brothers, halted funds to her campaign. CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett joins with an analysis of the 2024 race.
title: Koch network stops funding Haley campaign after South Carolina loss

description: Hungary's parliament voted Monday to ratify Sweden's bid to join NATO, clearing the way for the Nordic country to become the 32nd member of the military alliance. Charles Kupchan, senior fellow with the Council on Foreign Relations, joins CBS News to examine what led to NATO's expansion.
title: Hungary clears way for Sweden to join NATO

description: The Supreme Court heard two cases Monday that could change how Americans interact with social media. CBS News chief legal correspondent Jan Crawford breaks down the oral arguments.
title: Supreme Court appears divided over social media cases

description: The 2024 presidential race is now heading to Michigan, where both Democrat and Republican voters will vote in their party's primaries Tuesday. CBS News senior White House and political correspondent Ed O'Keefe has the latest from the battleground state.
title: 2024 presidential race heads to Michigan: What to know

description: Houston police released footage from two off-duty officers who were at Lakewood Church.
title: Body cam video released from Joel Osteen church shooting

description: Ruth Gottesman, a retired professor at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine and the widow of a former Wall Street executive, has donated $1 billion to the Bronx school. The donation will allow for free tuition going forward.
title: Massive donation provides free tuition at Bronx medical school

description: Federal law enforcement last year seized hundreds of pill presses, which are capable of producing thousands of pills an hour.
title: DEA cracks down on pill presses in latest front in the fight against fentanyl

description: Two Americans are believed to be dead after going missing in Grenada. Local officials believe they were killed when their yacht was allegedly hijacked by three escaped prisoners. Cristian Benavides has the latest.
title: Americans missing after suspected yacht hijacking in Grenada

description: Federal law enforcement officials are cracking down on pill presses, which drug traffickers can purchase online and use to pump out thousands of fentanyl pills an hour. Nicole Sganga takes an inside look at the efforts to seize these machines and prevent their sale.
title: DEA cracking down on pill presses

description: Two Americans are believed to be dead after going missing in Grenada. Local officials believe they were killed when their yacht was allegedly hijacked by three escaped prisoners. Cristian Benavides has the latest.
title: Missing Americans suspected dead after alleged yacht hijacking in Grenada

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned millions could die without more U.S. aid. Russia's invasion of Ukraine entered its third year over the weekend, and the ongoing assault is taking a heavy toll on the country, both in terms of casualties and morale. Charlie D'Agata reports.
title: Zelenskyy warns millions could die without U.S. aid

description: The city of Athens, Georgia, is reeling following the murder of 22-year-old Laken Riley, a nursing student at Augusta University whose body was found on the University of Georgia campus. Her murder has also set off a political firestorm after immigration officials said the murder suspect entered the country illegally. Mark Strassmann reports.
title: Athens, Georgia, shaken by college student's murder

description: Nikki Haley has yet to win a state primary or caucus in 2024, but she argues former President Trump's failure to win by even larger margins against her should be a warning sign for Republicans. Haley has vowed to stay in the race through Super Tuesday, but will have to do so after losing the backing of the Koch-funded Prosperity Action PAC. Ed O'Keefe reports.
title: Nikki Haley discusses her campaign's future

description: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg has requested a gag order for former President Trump ahead of his criminal trial, asking he be barred from commenting publicly about jurors, witnesses, court staff and DA staff. Meanwhile, a judge ruled an FBI informant accused of lying about President Biden and his son Hunter Biden's ties to a Ukrainian energy company must remain jailed before his trial. Scott MacFarlane reports.
title: Manhattan DA seeks gag order in Trump criminal trial

description: Police bodycam video from the shooting at celebrity pastor Joel Osteen's Lakewood Church earlier in February has been released. The shooter wounded one person and was shot and killed by off-duty police officers who were working as security. The shooter's 7-year-old son was shot in the exchange of gunfire and remains in critical condition. Janet Shamlian has the latest.
title: Bodycam video from Lakewood Church shooting released

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Monday, February 26, 2024

description: President Biden has said the U.S. was working to negotiate a hostage deal between Israel and Hamas that would pause fighting in Gaza for at least six weeks.
title: Biden says he hopes for Israel-Hamas cease-fire by next Monday
